intro: Chiarinia, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in spring and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chiarinia is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
